RSE Rest APIÂ¶

Overview

Resource Operation Description
Attributes GET /rses/(rse)/lfns2pfns Translate LFNs to PFNs.
  POST /rses/(rse)/attr/(key) Create RSE attribute.
  GET /rses/(rse)/attr List all RSE attributes.
  DELETE /rses/(rse)/attr/(key) Delete RSE attribute.
Distance PUT /rses/(source)/attr/(destination) Update RSE distance.
  POST /rses/(source)/attr/(destination) Create RSE distance.
  GET /rses/(source)/attr/(destination) Get RSE distance.
Limits PUT /rses/(rse)/limits Update RSE limits.
  GET /rses/(rse)/limits Get RSE limits.
Protocol PUT /rses/(rse)/protocols/(scheme)/(hostname)/(port) Update RSE protocol.
  POST /rses/(rse)/protocols/(scheme) Create an RSE protocol.
  GET /rses/(rse)/protocols/(scheme) List RSE protocol.
  DELETE /rses/(rse)/protocols/(scheme)/(hostname)/(port) Delete an RSE protocol.
Protocols GET /rses/(rse)/protocols List all RSE protocols.
RSE PUT /rses/(rse) Update an RSE.
  POST /rses/(rse) create a new RSE.
  GET /rses/(rse) get RSE details.
  DELETE /rses/(rse) disable RSE.
RSEAccountUsageLimit GET /rses/(rse)/accounts/usage Get account usage.
RSEs GET /rses/ List all RSEs.
Usage PUT /rses/(rse)/usage Update RSE usage.
  GET /rses/(rse)/usage Get RSE usage.
UsageHistory GET /rses/(rse)/usage/history Get RSE usage history.

Details

GET /rses/Â¶

List all RSEs.

Query Parameters:
 
  • expression â The returned list only contains RSE matching this expression.
Response Headers:
 
  • Content-Type â application/x-json-stream
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â DIDs found.
  • 400 Bad Request â Invalid RSE Expression.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid Auth Token.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
Returns:

A list containing all RSEs.
GET /rses/(rse)/accounts/usageÂ¶

Get account usage and limit for one RSE.

Parameters:
  • rse â the RSE name.
Response Headers:
 
  • Content-Type â application/json
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â OK.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid Auth Token.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE Not Found.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
Returns:

Line separated list of dict with account usage and limits.
GET /rses/(rse)/usage/historyÂ¶

Get RSE usage information.

Parameters:
  • rse â the RSE name.
Response Headers:
 
  • Content-Type â application/x-json-stream
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â OK.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid Auth Token.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE Not Found.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
Returns:

Line separated list of dictionary with RSE usage information.
PUT /rses/(rse)/protocols/(scheme)/(hostname)/(port)Â¶

Updates attributes of an existing protocol entry. Because protocol identifier, hostname, and port are used as unique identifier they are immutable.

Parameters:
  • rse â The RSE name.
  • scheme â The protocol identifier.
  • hostname â The hostname defined for the scheme, used if more than one scheme is registered with the same identifier.
  • port â The port registered for the hostname, ued if more than one scheme is registered with the same identifier and hostname.
Request JSON Object:
 
  • paramaters (dict) â parameter of the new protocol entry.
Status Codes:
  • 201 Created â Created.
  • 400 Bad Request â Cannot decode json parameter dictionary.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid Auth Token.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE not found.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE Protocol Not Supported.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE Protocol Domain Not Supported.
  • 409 Conflict â RSE Protocol Priority Error.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
POST /rses/(rse)/protocols/(scheme)Â¶

Create a protocol for a given RSE.

Parameters:
  • rse â The RSE name.
  • scheme â The protocol identifier.
Request JSON Object:
 
  • paramaters (dict) â parameter of the new protocol entry.
Status Codes:
  • 201 Created â Created.
  • 400 Bad Request â Cannot decode json parameter dictionary.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid Auth Token.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE not found.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE Protocol Domain Not Supported.
  • 409 Conflict â RSE Protocol Priority Error.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
GET /rses/(rse)/protocols/(scheme)Â¶

List all references of the provided RSE for the given protocol.

Parameters:
  • rse â The RSE name.
  • scheme â The protocol identifier.
Response Headers:
 
  • Content-Type â application/json
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â OK.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid Auth Token.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE Not Found.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE Protocol Not Supported.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE Protocol Domain Not Supported.
Returns:

A list with detailed protocol information.
DELETE /rses/(rse)/protocols/(scheme)/(hostname)/(port)Â¶

Deletes a protocol entry for the provided RSE.

Parameters:
  • rse â The RSE name.
  • scheme â The protocol identifier.
  • hostname â The hostname defined for the scheme, used if more than one scheme is registered with the same identifier.
  • port â The port registered for the hostname, ued if more than one scheme is registered with the same identifier and hostname.
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â OK.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid Auth Token.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE not found.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE Protocol Not Supported.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
GET /rses/(rse)/protocolsÂ¶

List all supported protocols of the given RSE.

Parameters:
  • rse â The RSE name.
Response Headers:
 
  • Content-Type â application/json
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â OK.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid Auth Token.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE Operation Not Supported.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE Not Found.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE Protocol Domain Not Supported.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE Protocol Not Supported.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
Returns:

A list containing all supported protocols and all their attributes.
GET /rses/(rse)/lfns2pfnsÂ¶

Return PFNs for a set of LFNs. Formatted as a JSON object where the key is a LFN and the value is the corresponding PFN.

Parameters:
  • rse â The RSE name.
  • scheme â The protocol identifier.
Query Parameters:
 
  • lfn â One or moref LFN to translate.
  • scheme â Optional argument to help with the protocol selection (e.g., http / gsiftp / srm)
  • domain â Optional argument used to select the protocol for wan or lan use cases.
  • operation â Optional query argument to select the protoco for read-vs-writes.
Response Headers:
 
  • Content-Type â application/json
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â OK.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid Auth Token.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE Not Found.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE Protocol Not Supported.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE Protocol Domain Not Supported.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
Returns:

A list with detailed PFN information.
PUT /rses/(rse)/limitsÂ¶

Update RSE limits.

Parameters:
  • rse â The RSE name.
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â OK.
  • 400 Bad Request â Cannot decode json parameter dictionary.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid Auth Token.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE Not Found.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
GET /rses/(rse)/limitsÂ¶

Get RSE limits.

Parameters:
  • rse â the RSE name.
Response Headers:
 
  • Content-Type â application/json
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â OK.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid Auth Token.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE Not Found.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
Returns:

List of dictionaries with RSE limits.
PUT /rses/(rse)/usageÂ¶

Update RSE usage information.

Parameters:
  • rse â The RSE name.
Request JSON Object:
 
  • parameter (dict) â Dictionary with âsourceâ, âusedâ, âfreeâ values to update.
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â OK.
  • 400 Bad Request â Cannot decode json parameter dictionary.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid Auth Token.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE not found.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
GET /rses/(rse)/usageÂ¶

Get RSE usage information.

Parameters:
  • rse â the RSE name.
Query Parameters:
 
  • source â The information source, e.g., srm.
  • per_account â Boolean whether the usage should be also calculated per account or not.
Response Headers:
 
  • Content-Type â application/x-json-stream
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â OK.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid Auth Token.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE Not Found.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
Returns:

A list of dictionaries with the usage information.
POST /rses/(rse)/attr/(key)Â¶

create RSE attribute with given RSE name.

Parameters:
  • rse â RSE name.
  • key â Key attribute.
Request JSON Object:
 
  • parameter (dict) â Dictionary with âvalueâ.
Status Codes:
  • 201 Created â Created.
  • 400 Bad Request â Cannot decode json parameter dictionary.
  • 400 Bad Request â Key not defined.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid Auth Token.
  • 409 Conflict â Attribute already exists.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
GET /rses/(rse)/attrÂ¶

list all RSE attributes for a RSE.

Parameters:
  • rse â RSE name.
Response Headers:
 
  • Content-Type â application/json
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â OK.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid Auth Token.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
Returns:

A list containing all RSE attributes.
DELETE /rses/(rse)/attr/(key)Â¶

Delete an RSE attribute for given RSE name.

Parameters:
  • rse â RSE name.
  • key â The key name.
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â OK.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid Auth Token.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE not found.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
PUT /rses/(source)/attr/(destination)Â¶

Update distance information between source RSE and destination RSE.

Parameters:
  • source â The source RSE name.
  • destination â The destination RSE name.
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â OK.
  • 400 Bad Request â Cannot decode json parameter dictionary.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid Auth Token.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE Not Found.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
POST /rses/(source)/attr/(destination)Â¶

Create distance information between source RSE and destination RSE.

Parameters:
  • source â The source RSE name.
  • destination â The destination RSE name.
Status Codes:
  • 201 Created â Created.
  • 400 Bad Request â Cannot decode json parameter dictionary.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid Auth Token.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE Not Found.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
GET /rses/(source)/attr/(destination)Â¶

Get RSE distance between source and destination.

Parameters:
  • source â the source RSE name.
  • destination â the destination RSE name.
Response Headers:
 
  • Content-Type â application/json
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â OK.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid Auth Token.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
Returns:

List of dictionaries with RSE distances.
PUT /rses/(rse)Â¶

Update RSE properties (e.g. name, availability).

Parameters:
  • rse â The RSE name.
Request JSON Object:
 
  • parameters (dict) â Dictionary of parameters to update.
Status Codes:
  • 201 Created â RSE updated successfully.
  • 400 Bad Request â Cannot decode json parameter dictionary.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid Auth Token.
  • 409 Conflict â RSE not found.
  • 409 Conflict â RSE already exists.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
POST /rses/(rse)Â¶

Create RSE with given name.

Parameters:
  • rse â The RSE name.
Request JSON Object:
 
  • deterministic (bool) â Boolean to know if the pfn is generated deterministically.
  • volatile (bool) â Boolean for RSE cache.
  • city (string) â City for the RSE.
  • staging_area (bool) â Staging area.
  • region_code (string) â The region code for the RSE.
  • country_name (string) â The country.
  • continent (string) â The continent.
  • time_zone (string) â Timezone.
  • ISP (string) â Internet Service Provider.
Status Codes:
  • 201 Created â RSE created successfully.
  • 400 Bad Request â Cannot decode json parameter dictionary.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid Auth Token.
  • 409 Conflict â RSE already exists.
  • 409 Conflict â RSE not found.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
GET /rses/(rse)Â¶

Details about a specific RSE.

Parameters:
  • rse â the RSE name.
Response Headers:
 
  • Content-Type â application/json
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â OK.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid Auth Token.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE not found.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
Returns:

A list containing all RSEs.
DELETE /rses/(rse)Â¶

Disable RSE with given RSE name.

Parameters:
  • rse â the RSE name.
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â OK.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid Auth Token.
  • 404 Not Found â RSE not found.
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Internal Error.
